- best part of GKE is node pools
	- create pools of similar nodes
	- manually or automatically upgrade them
- Cluster types
	- single zone
		- single control plane
		- workloads in a single zone
	- multi zone
	- regional clusters
		- multiple copies of the control plane
		- and nodes across all zones
- [[Private Google Access]] is enabled by default in GKE clusters
- can choose between three release channels for cluster versioning cadence
	- Rapid
		- uses newest [[Kubernetes]] version possible
		- has the latest features available
	- Regular (default)
		- same as Rapid but has a 2-3 month lag time
	- Stable
		- 2-3 months after release regular
		- only stable versions
- Surge Upgrading
	- max-surge-upgrade is the amount of nodes added to the node pool during an upgrade
	- max-unavailable-upgrade is amount of nodes that can be simultaneously down
